alert.note: Alert for Boone; Lincoln; Logan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:41PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lincoln, north central Logan and northwestern Boone Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1241 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Spurlockville, or 9 miles northwest of Madison, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, Logan, Chapmanville, Chief Logan State, Spurlockville, Julian, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Danville, West Logan, Mitchell Heights, Turtle Creek, Woodville, Blair, Sharples, Alkol, Mud and Jeffrey. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 33 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
